byline.contributor: Nicholas Confessore reported from New York, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Indictment of New Jersey Sen Robert Menendez is first major campaign corruption case evolving out of Supreme Court's Citizens United decision, which narrowed constitutional definition of political corruption and made it harder for prosecutors to prove bribery; case will center on how money given to Menendez was funneled through technically independent political action committees.
lead_paragraph: The indictment of Senator Menendez is the first significant corruption case since the Supreme Court’s Citizens United decision, which loosened restrictions on campaign contributions.

headline.main: Robert Menendez Indictment Points to Corrupting Potential of Super PACs
headline.print_headline: Menendez Case Focuses on Role of Super PACs

snippet: The indictment of Senator Menendez is the first significant corruption case since the Supreme Court’s Citizens United decision, which loosened restrictions on campaign contributions.

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
